com.clarionmedia.infinitum.di

Interface BeanFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConfigurableBeanFactory

    public interface BeanFactory

    Stores beans that have been configured in infinitum.cfg.xml or through annotations. The BeanFactory acts as a service locator for InfinitumContext. Beans are retrieved by their name and registered by providing a name, class, and field values.

    BeanFactory is responsible for maintaining a bean registry, initializing bean instances, and performing any necessary dependency injections.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0 05/18/12
    Author:
    Tyler Treat

    • Method Detail

      • loadBean

        java.lang.Object loadBean(java.lang.String name)
                          throws InfinitumConfigurationException
        Retrieves an instance of the bean with the given name. The name is configured in infinitum.cfg.xml or the Bean annotation.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the bean to retrieve
        Returns:
        an instance of the bean
        Throws:
        InfinitumConfigurationException - if the bean does not exist or could not be constructed

      • loadBean

        <T> T loadBean(java.lang.String name,
             java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
           throws InfinitumConfigurationException
        Retrieves an instance of the bean with the given name and Class. The name is configured in infinitum.cfg.xml or the Bean annotation.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the bean to retrieve
        clazz - the type of the bean to retrieve
        Returns:
        an instance of the bean
        Throws:
        InfinitumConfigurationException - if the bean does not exist, could not be constructed, or is of the wrong type

        Returns:

      • findCandidateBean

        java.lang.Object findCandidateBean(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Resolves an autowire dependency for the given Class. This will return an instance of the Class or one of its derivatives from this BeanFactory. If there is no candidate, it will return null. An InfinitumConfigurationException will be thrown if more than one candidate is found.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the Class of the candidate
        Returns:
        bean candidate or null if none exists
        Throws:
        InfinitumConfigurationException - if more than one autowire candidate is found

      • findCandidateBeanName

        java.lang.String findCandidateBeanName(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Retrieves the name of a bean which satisfies the given Class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the Class of the candidate
        Returns:
        bean candidate name or null if none exists
        Throws:
        InfinitumConfigurationException - if more than one autowire candidate is found
